reviews.message: Miossi wisely avoids hammering home obvious connections about the age of human and machine, instead making this about how they care.

reviews.name: Seth Freilich
reviews.message: Things go a bit sideways and we viewers suddenly find ourselves actively rooting for this beautiful, dumb, and amazing little hunk of metal that is so very far away. How it plays out is almost beside the point.

title: Buddy Games: Spring Awakening
description: Dan Bakkedahl (Veep), Kevin Dillon (Entourage), Josh Duhamel (Transformers Franchise), James Roday Rodriguez (Psych), and Nick Swardson (Grandma's Boy) reunite for the hilariously outrageous sequel to the hit comedy! Faced with their biggest challenge yet, the gang sets out to honor a lost friend only to find themselves in the middle of where it all began -- Spring Break -- where they learn their old school ways of partying hardly compete with today's generation.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Some Nudity|Crude Sexual Material|Language Throughout|Drug Use|Violent Material)
characteristics.Producer:: Josh Duhamel, Michael J. Luisi

reviews.name: Peter Sobczynski
reviews.message: Spectacularly awful in every imaginable aspect.

reviews.name: Douglas Davidson
reviews.message: ... is exactly the film you think it’s going to be: silly, crude, and purely for entertainment purposes and, on that mark, it delivers.

title: On Our Way
description: Henry contemplates suicide while writing the end to his newest script - a retelling of his past with his lost love, Rosemary. As a dark voice pushes him to the brink, Rosemary fights to make him believe in himself before it is too late.

characteristics.Producer:: Heliya Alam, Joe Barbagallo, Andrea Bucko, John Reyes Doyle, Siena Oberman, Alex Safdie, Adam G. Simon, Kyle Stroud, Julio Lopez Velasquez
characteristics.Production Co:: Matlock Entertainment, Boxcar Pictures., Paola Paulin Ventures, Tomorrowland Productions, BarBHouse, Sugar Rush Pictures, Artemis, Carte Blanche Film, Commonwealth Pictures

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Writer-director-co-star Curtis uses the editing and jumbling of the story order (lots of repetition) to cover up the thinness of the material, and perhaps hide the milquetoast nature of the performances.

reviews.name: Rob Aldam
reviews.message: While On Our Way shows tonnes of promise, it never really all comes together, but does act as a calling card for a new voice with plenty to say.

title: Sidhus of Southall
description: A financially crippled and dysfunctional Punjabi family tries to get itself out of trouble during a millionaire's wedding celebrations.

characteristics.Producer:: Gunbir Singh Sidhu, Manmord Sidhu

title: 8 A.M. Metro
description: The mundane life of Iravati -- a 29-year-old housewife living in Nanded -- is thrown into mild disarray when she is asked to look after her pregnant sister, Riya, in Hyderabad after complications arise. Triumphing over her irrational fear of traveling alone, she takes on the role of her guardian and caretaker while her brother-in-law, Abhiram, is away for work. Unbeknownst to her, the journey is just the first of many, and there is no smooth sailing. A childhood incident triggers panic attacks and she (literally) latches on to the closest kind stranger; albeit one, who battles demons of his own. Preetam, a seemingly ordinary banker, fosters crippling depression and is haunted by his past. They find solace with each other and forge an unlikely friendship traversing many conversations and a physical as well as metaphorical series of journeys that lead to emotional evolution. They inadvertently give each other the will to truly live. But Preetam harbors a devastating secret that might destroy their relationship and threaten to dismantle everything they believe in if unraveled.

characteristics.Producer:: Kishore Ganji, Raj Rachakonda

title: The Secret Society for Slow Romance 2: Cosmic Disco Detective Rene

characteristics.Producer:: Sujewa Ekanayake

title: Museum of the Revolution
description: "The wind got up in the night and took our plans away," reads the proverb in the opening titles of MUSEUM OF THE REVOLUTION. It's a reference to the 1961 plan to build a grand museum in Belgrade as a tribute to Socialist Yugoslavia. Meant to "safeguard the truth" about the Yugoslav people, the plan never got beyond the construction of the basement. The derelict building now tells a very different story from the one envisioned by the initiators 60 years ago. The cavernous, damp, pitch-dark space is inhabited by the outcasts of a society reshaped by capitalism: a precocious and energetic little girl who earns cash on the street by cleaning car windows with her mother, and their friend, an older woman also living in the basement. In his award-winning, visually stunning and formally daring feature documentary debut, director and cinematographer Srdjan Keca powerfully illuminates the tender relationship between the three women -- a source of refuge, community, and hope -- against the backdrop of a city in transformation.

characteristics.Producer:: Vanja Jambrovic, Srdjan Keca
characteristics.Production Co:: Nutprodukce, Croatian Radiotelevision, Al Jazeera Documentary Channel

reviews.name: Natalia Winkelman
reviews.message: This is an engrossing documentary, and one that raises questions about the ethics of intervening (or not) in the lives of people struggling to get by.

reviews.name: Vladan Petkovic
reviews.message: We see... two women beaten, bruised and broken by their lives – but still not giving up.

reviews.name: Christopher Cross
reviews.message: Museum of the Revolution is an intimate but painful watch.

characteristics.Producer:: Essaki Durai

title: Charles Enterprises
description: Charles Enterprises is a fascinating depiction of how Ravi Kumaraswamy, a young man from Kochi suffering from night blindness, a congenital disability, steals a Ganesha idol from his mother, Gomathi, a profound devotee. Later he tries to overcome the ensuing crises and reclaim his life, which becomes more difficult due to the social situation thoroughly affected by the pandemic

characteristics.Director:: Subhash Lalitha Subrahmanian, Subhash Lalitha Subramanian
characteristics.Producer:: Ajith Joy, Achu Vijayan

reviews.name: Anna M.M. Vetticad
reviews.message: ...Charles Enterprises is packed with interesting actors and ideas that fade into the background in the face of a rambling script and listless direction. The writer mistakenly assumes that piling people on to a story amounts to layering and depth.

title: National Theatre Live: Best of Enemies
description: In 1968 America, as two men fight to become the next president, all eyes are on the battle between two others: the cunningly conservative William F. Buckley Jr., and the unruly liberal Gore Vidal. During a new nightly television format, they debate the moral landscape of a shattered nation. As beliefs are challenged and slurs slung, a new frontier in American politics is opening and television news is about to be transformed forever. Jeremy Herrin (All My Sons) directs this blistering political thriller, filmed live in London's West End.

title: Victim/Suspect
description: On her first solo investigation, journalist Rae de Leon travels nationwide to uncover a shocking pattern: Young women tell the police they've been sexually assaulted, but instead of finding justice, they're charged with the crime of making a false report, arrested, and even imprisoned by the system they believed would protect them.

characteristics.Producer:: Christopher Clements, Rachel De Leon, Julie Goldman, Alice Henty, Amanda Pike, Nancy Schwartzman
characteristics.Production Co:: Center for Investigative Repor, Motto Pictures

reviews.name: Brianna Zigler
reviews.message: Victim/Suspect manages to be at once fascinating, improperly focused and somewhat redundant.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: An artless documentary that feels overwritten and orchestrated to a fault. The topic is important and infuriating, but it’s not a particularly well-made film.

reviews.name: Kent Turner
reviews.message: [A] powerful, hard-hitting investigative documentary.

reviews.name: Sheri Flanders
reviews.message: This documentary doesn’t offer much in terms of craft, but one could perhaps make the argument that the subject matter necessitates no-frills storytelling that soberly focuses on facts and video evidence.

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: A revealing study on two sides of journalism: the tabloid press that accuses without evidence and sows disinformation, further stigmatizing these women; and investigative journalism that digs into minefields... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: It’s easy to feel overwhelmed with sadness and empathy for the victims. Easy to feel proud that a young reporter and documentarian turned wrong into right. That takes courage.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: [Victim/Suspect] suffers from the Netflix brand of overproduction, looking just a little too flashy and sinking everything with voiceover and interview sound bites that have been scripted to death.

reviews.name: Barbara Goslawski
reviews.message: Yes, the film generates a sense of the anger at the system that has perpetrated this injustice but not enough to warrant much further thought or even action.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: A very solid, depressing piece of accessible documentary journalism about a very troubling trend.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: A heartbreaking but eye-opening piece of filmmaking.

reviews.name: Sheri Linden
reviews.message: Measured and sometimes muddled, but unquestionably important.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: A strong, powerful documentary that, despite feeling a tad neat and cold at times, benefits from De Leon's presence. And most importantly: it is a film that will remain engraved in your memories for a long time. Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: Sarah Bea Milner
reviews.message: An upsetting documentary.

reviews.name: Andrew Parker
reviews.message: Victim/Suspect ends up being a vital and eye opening examination of widespread injustice that still leaves a lot on the table thanks to its strangely narrow focus.

reviews.name: Lena Wilson
reviews.message: You may need to take a month-long depression nap after you finish watching it, but this documentary will stick with you.

reviews.name: Kate Erbland
reviews.message: It’s all so very sober, so deeply sobering, that when actual emotion pops, that’s what jars. It shouldn’t be the case -- all of this should rattle us and move us into action.

reviews.name: Fran Hoepfner
reviews.message: That these stories are worth being told is inarguable, but is this the proper lens to go about it?

title: The Little Mermaid
description: The youngest of King Triton's daughters, and the most defiant, Ariel longs to find out more about the world beyond the sea, and while visiting the surface, falls for the dashing Prince Eric. While mermaids are forbidden to interact with humans, Ariel must follow her heart. She makes a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, which gives her a chance to experience life on land, but ultimately places her life -- and her father's crown -- in jeopardy.

characteristics.Producer:: Marc Platt, Lin-Manuel Miranda, John DeLuca, Rob Marshall
characteristics.Production Co:: 5000 Broadway Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, Lucamar, Marc Platt Productions

title: About My Father
description: The hottest comic in America, Sebastian Maniscalco joins forces with legendary Italian-American and two-time Oscar winner, Robert De Niro, in the new comedy ABOUT MY FATHER. The film centers around Sebastian (Maniscalco) who is encouraged by his fiancée (Leslie Bibb) to bring his immigrant, hairdresser father, Salvo (De Niro), to a weekend get-together with her super-rich and exceedingly eccentric family (Kim Cattrall, Anders Holm, Brett Dier, David Rasche). The weekend develops into what can only be described as a culture clash, leaving Sebastian and Salvo to discover that the great thing about family is everything about family.

characteristics.Producer:: Andrew Miano, Paul Weitz, Chris Weitz, Judi Marmel

title: The Machine
description: Bert Kreischer rose to fame as a stand-up comedian known as The Machine, and in his signature set he recounts his true experience with Russian mobsters while on a booze-soaked college trip. Now, 23 years later, that trip has come back to haunt him as he and his estranged father (Mark Hamill) are kidnapped back to Russia by the mob to atone for something they say he did. Together, Bert and his father must retrace the steps of his younger self (Jimmy Tatro) in the midst of a war within a sociopathic crime family, all while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Some Sexual References|Pervasive Language|Drug Use|Strong Violence)
characteristics.Producer:: Bert Kreischer, LeeAnn Kreischer, Judi Marmel, Cale Boyter, Peter Atencio

title: Kandahar
description: An undercover CIA operative gets stuck in hostile territory in Afghanistan after his mission is exposed. Accompanied by his translator, he must fight enemy combatants as he tries to reach an extraction point in Kandahar.

characteristics.Producer:: Basil Iwanyk, Brendon Boyea, Erica Lee, Gerard Butler, Alan Siegel, Christian Mercuri, Scott LaStaiti
characteristics.Production Co:: MBC Studios, Thunder Road Pictures, Capstone Studios, G-BASE

title: You Hurt My Feelings
description: Beth (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), a popular writer, and her husband Don, a well-liked teacher, share the kind of relationship that truly, seriously, for the love of God cannot be real: that is, they're actually in love. Even after decades of marriage, parenting, and their own successful careers, their physical spark has somehow not diminished; in fact, they seem to relish the opportunity to share a single ice cream cone and drive others -- including their son, Charlie -- mad. Should it come as a surprise then that his own marriage is in crisis? But when Beth discovers that Don has been untruthful to her about his opinion of her work for years -- Beth's world comes crashing down. Has their whole relationship been one Big Fat Lie?

characteristics.Producer:: Stefanie Azpiazu, Anthony Bregman, Nicole Holofcener, Julia Louis-Dreyfus

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Holofcener accesses moving material that will make you laugh, possibly cry, and come away feeling a little wiser for it. Such modest pleasures at the cinema feel rare but vital.

reviews.name: Anthony Lane
reviews.message: Well, this setup might possibly furnish a single episode of “Seinfeld.” Whether it’s enough to sustain a whole movie is another matter.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: A twee...slight sociological study that takes navel-gazing New Yorkers into their AARP years, still comfortably discomfitted by the littlest things, still making mountains out of lives littered with molehills.

reviews.name: Erik Childress
reviews.message: Nicole Holofcener just does not miss and her reunion with Julia Louis-Dreyfus is one of her best in hilariously charting the perils of the damage that can be inflicted by false confidence and loving reassurance with characters who feel authentic.

reviews.name: Brian Rowe
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is as good as Enough Said, if not better, and I hope she makes more films with Louis-Dreyfus. The two have a kinship that works beautifully on a narrative level...

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: Crackerjack writing and a talented cast make this very relatable (and funny) adult comedy-drama achieve its full potential.

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: An constant supply of quotable zingers lends energy to almost every scene

reviews.name: Martin Carr
reviews.message: Tried, tested, and uninspiring - this four way relationship drama goes over old ground.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Delivers with a light touch a well-observed drama.

reviews.name: Piers Marchant
reviews.message: Collectively, these exquisitely rendered moments begin to form a much greater whole, creating a sense of the world for [Nicole Holofcener's] characters that somehow expands far beyond what we actually see of them.

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: Through everyday life situations and seemingly trivial conversations, Holofcener's excellent screenplay and the spot-on performances of the cast explore the theme of personal realization with a sharp sense of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: Especially married couples will be able to relate to this story and its wonderful dialogue

reviews.name: Daniel Joyaux
reviews.message: What ensues is a poignant and funny investigation into the little lies of encouragement we spout to our loved ones and the damage it can do when those built-up fibs are suddenly revealed.

reviews.name: Zoë Rose Bryant
reviews.message: It’s tender, terrifically funny, and endlessly thought-provoking, and it sends you out on a heartfelt high with new knowledge to apply to your own life, so you learn from Beth and Don’s miscommunications instead of repeating their mistakes yourself.

reviews.name: Andrea Thompson
reviews.message: It might be Holofcener’s most tender portrayal yet of a woman whose world is upended just as she’s at a critical crossroads in her life.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: One of [Holofcener's] smartest and funniest films.

reviews.name: Ross Bonaime
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is the type of film that reminds us why Holofcener is one of the best writers of comedies today, and that her ability to write films with such small consequences can often feel like a massive achievement.

reviews.name: Pat Mullen
reviews.message: The film marks Holofcener's best work since 2010’s Please Give for its warm, witty, and wise consideration of relationships.

reviews.name: Frank J. Avella
reviews.message: It's bracing to have a relationship dramedy that is not centered on infidelity, but about the way we as humans are so simultaneously fragile and narcissistic.

reviews.name: Alissa Wilkinson
reviews.message: The resulting film is warm-hearted and rueful and hilarious in all the best ways.

reviews.name: Eric Marchen
reviews.message: A charming comedy full of sensitive observations.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: The best film of Sundance 2023 was Nicole Holofcener’s surprisingly resonant You Hurt My Feelings, which might be the best film ever made about our societal inability to handle various forms of criticism.

reviews.name: Jason Adams
reviews.message: Sweet and genuine and perfectly human-sized... a simple and lovely fable about how honest we need to be with the people closest to us, You Hurt My Feelings is honest in every single place that it counts.

reviews.name: Christopher Llewellyn Reed
reviews.message: If not every joke or sentiment strikes the perfect note, the resultant melody nevertheless forms a moving cinematic sonata.

reviews.name: Mae Abdulbaki
reviews.message: While the film isn’t overly ambitious or deep, it’s an energetic, occasionally thoughtful & honest film about the lack of honesty & its effects.

reviews.name: Lauren Coates
reviews.message: Though it may not be particularly ambitious or original, the film’s examination of self-image and lying to the people you love is clever, focused one, resulting in an instant comfort watch with an impressive cast.

reviews.name: Joey Magidson
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is effective yet familiar territory for Nicole Holofcener.

reviews.name: Sarah Marrs
reviews.message: It’s another incredible collaboration between Nicole Holofcener and Julia Louis-Dreyfus, well worth the ten-year wait.

reviews.name: Sarah Manvel
reviews.message: It’s so refreshing that a director as talented and sharp as Ms. Holofcener is continuing to make movies which know the little issues are often just as important as the bigger ones.

reviews.name: Hannah Strong
reviews.message: It’s a sweet, slight film about the nagging worry at the back of every artist’s head: they’re actually just a mediocre talent, being politely humoured by their friends and family.

reviews.name: Jeff Nelson
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings takes a small instance and expands it into something funny and relatable.

reviews.name: Shaun Munro
reviews.message: Nicole Holofcener delivers a slight, breezy, wryly funny dramedy on honesty, insecurity, and ego in relationships. Julia Louis-Dreyfus is, unsurprisingly, magnetic.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: Julia Louis-Dreyfus is magnificent while the supporting cast is great. In a cinematic world filled with ear-splitting special effects and out of this world characters, it is a refreshing look at regular people and the world they are trying to live in.

reviews.name: Jacob Oller
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings, which confronts middle-aged neuroses and creative anxieties with all the subtlety of a bestselling author with a new Twitter account, still finds warmth amid its middling dramedy.

reviews.name: Peter Howell
reviews.message: A barbed comedy about human failings and the equally human tendency not to be truthful about them.

reviews.name: Nicolas Rapold
reviews.message: It achieves a level of total stylistic commitment more common in European art cinema than American indies, but with a voice all its own.

reviews.name: Clint Worthington
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is a quirky, incisive study of ego death, of what happens when you learn you’re not the hot shit you thought you were and have to recalibrate accordingly.

reviews.name: Alex Saveliev
reviews.message: Hysterical, insightful, gentle, and touching, You Hurt My Feelings is a breath of the freshest air you can imagine.

reviews.name: Stephanie Zacharek
reviews.message: It’s both smart and entertaining.

reviews.name: Gayle Sequeira
reviews.message: A warm, thoughtful drama in which a careless remark spurs larger observations about whether white lies are really better than harsh truths and if it’s possible to love someone when you don’t care for a large part of what makes them, them.

title: The Wrath of Becky
description: Two years after she escaped a violent attack on her family, Becky attempts to rebuild her life in the care of an older woman -- a kindred spirit named Elena. But when a group known as the "Noble Men" break into their home, attack them, and take her beloved dog, Diego, Becky must return to her old ways to protect herself and her loved ones.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Strong Bloody Violence|Gore|Some Sexual References|Pervasive Language)
characteristics.Producer:: Russ Posternak, Raphael Margules, J.D. Lifshitz, Chadd Harbold, Jordan Yale Levine, Jordan Beckerman, Tracy Rosenblum
characteristics.Production Co:: Media Finance Capital, Yale Productions, Post Film, Fluffy Bear Studios, RainMaker Films, BoulderLight Pictures, Quiver Distribution

reviews.name: Dan Scully
reviews.message: Delivers on strong thematic and character work, while also providing no shortage of splattery, cathartic violence to boot.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Campy fun? Yes. Ultra-violent? You bet! What separates Becky is that it’s not aiming for the “comedy” part of horror comedy. It’s organically funny and while the situations are off the wall, the natural progression of the storyline isn’t.

reviews.name: Dolores Quintana
reviews.message: THE WRATH OF BECKY is a serviceable film with some decent gore, but it has some ideas you have already seen before.

reviews.name: Drew Tinnin
reviews.message: Wrath of Becky is much more than a fantasy revenge tale about getting even with white trash nationalists and dumb-witted domestic terrorists.It’s an official coming out party for star-in-the-making Lulu Wilson.

reviews.name: Dustin Rowles
reviews.message: The tone of the sequel is more cartoonish than the original -- the lighting is brighter and the blood is redder -- but it’s no less satisfying.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: There’s a charming simplicity to a genre film that can be introduced as “Let’s just kill some fascists!” and Angel & Coote know how to pace and deliver this kind of gut punch of a movie.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: The cheeky film has the same fiery revenge tone as the original even with new directors and writers.

reviews.name: J Hurtado
reviews.message: If the first film was Home Alone, this one is a bit more John Wick, only with less martial arts and more exploding fascist rednecks, and that is totally cool with me.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Becky’s need for teen kicks delivers enough delinquent destruction of Nazis to bring bloody satisfaction.

reviews.name: Martin Unsworth
reviews.message: Outrageously over the top, The Wrath of Becky goes against the grain when it comes to sequels – particularly when they don’t contain input from the core behind-the-scenes crew – in that it’s even more fun than the original.

reviews.name: Dan Tabor
reviews.message: Wrath of Becky is a blood-drenched blast from start to finish and the perfect film for any genre fan looking for a bit of that ultraviolence.

reviews.name: Matt Donato
reviews.message: A fun-filled slaughter-fest.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky manages to bring everything together and never feels like the importance of the issues are being downplayed. The villains are an immediate threat to Becky, but they will also be recognizable to audiences.

reviews.name: Meagan Navarro
reviews.message: Angel and Coote’s playful tonal shift becomes instrumental in the sequel’s success as an entertaining action-horror-comedy romp, and Wilson is more than game in taking Becky less seriously. It makes for an irreverently delightful time.

reviews.name: Kat Hughes
reviews.message: Lulu Wilson’s Becky is always a fun character to spend time with, but despite the best efforts of all involved, The Wrath of Becky pales in comparison to what came before.

title: The Hole in the Fence
description: At a secluded exclusive summer camp in the Mexican countryside, under the watchful eyes of their adult guardians, boys from a prestigious private school receive physical, moral and religious training to turn them into tomorrow's elite. The discovery of a hole in the fence sets in motion a chain of disturbing events as the boys devolve into a Lord of the Flies-like mob mentality that creates and spreads hysteria in this profoundly disturbing coming-of-age drama that unravels like a horror movie while drawing on actual events.

characteristics.Producer:: Fernanda De la Peza

reviews.name: Hugo Lara
reviews.message: [Del Paso] maximizes his main location, a place in the middle of the forest, filmed with an atmosphere that suddenly recharges with psychological terror... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Javier Perez
reviews.message: Lacks a dramatic anchor to bond with the audience despite some unsettling dramatic flashes and tensions. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alejandro Alemán
reviews.message: Del Paso reinforces his ability to portray chaos, and through its montage, have fear and indignation invade us. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carlos Bonfil
reviews.message: An intelligent thriller, with agile rhythm, stupendous artistry in photography and sound, and a polarizing theme that is open to discourse. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: The Hole in the Fence is a story that captures [the essence of] what you read about in the papers. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Fernanda Solórzano
reviews.message: The Hole in the Fence manages to build a sinister universe that, on the one hand, is close to us and, on the other, is inserted into a vein of horror mythology. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carson Timar
reviews.message: It is hard to argue against The Hole in the Fence being anything but one of the best films of the year.

reviews.name: Vassilis Kroustallis
reviews.message: A skillful attempt to bring a reality usually (and understandably) hidden from view; it will mobilize its various actors in an orchestrated way.

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: Despite being rather on the nose in terms of his plot beats, del Paso has an eye for a strong image and a psychological feel for the insidious viewpoint of the adults, washing over the children like a bad benediction.

reviews.name: Israel Acosta Aroche
reviews.message: Joaquín del Paso brings us a provocative and shocking film that manages to mix elements of psychological terror and political criticism. [Full review in Spanish]

title: Will-o'-the-Wisp
description: On his deathbed, his royal highness Alfredo, King without a crown, is taken back to distant youth memories and the time he dreamt of becoming a fireman. The encounter with instructor Afonso from the fire brigade, opens a new chapter in the life of the two young men immersed in love and desire, and the will to change the status quo.

characteristics.Producer:: Vincent Wang, João Matos, João Pedro Rodrigues
characteristics.Writer:: João Pedro Rodrigues, João Rui Guerra Da Mata, Paulo Lopes Graça

reviews.name: Fernando Bernal
reviews.message: Rodrigues' musical fantasy is a fascinating cinematic challenge. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carlos Losilla
reviews.message: Contemplates reality as a delusion worth living and, therefore, as a privilege that no one has the right to take away from us. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Amparo Cabal
reviews.message: A brief but fun and memorable film with a queer perspective and a very unique sense of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jason Shawhan
reviews.message: [It] delivers ample amounts of firehouse choreography and dangling parts.

reviews.name: Ankit Jhunjhunwala
reviews.message: Above all functions as a love story, even though it has a lot of tricks up its sleeve.

reviews.name: Lee Jutton
reviews.message: It’s altogether hilarious and yet still heartfelt, extremely weird but wonderful regardless—just like the rest of Will-o’-the-Wisp.

reviews.name: Jason Adams
reviews.message: A beefcake fantasia of masculine camaraderie that’s spills into dance and forest-floor mutual masturbation

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: Rodrigues conceives a lush tree of a story that feeds off multiple genres: absurdist comedy, musical, coming-of-age, interracial romance, and shameless eroticism. And at its roots, lies an intelligent sociopolitical subtext. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matthew St. Clair
reviews.message: Rodrigues' ability to condense a myriad of genres into a small package is a grand feat.

reviews.name: Tomas Trussow
reviews.message: It bounces in the interstices of varying genres and critiques, undaunted by the fact that not every strike is cleanly wrought, but confident in being caustic when needed, while also giving satire a breath of much-needed fresh air.

reviews.name: Carlos Esquives
reviews.message: João Pedro Rodrigues isn't subtle in blaming repressions on colonialist heritage and in the process, he continues to pave way for diversity of expression in his homoerotic universe. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kent Turner
reviews.message: Portuguese director João Pedro Rodrigues goes for it in the low-budget "Fogo-Fátuo," the most audacious, funniest, and unpredictable work seen at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival.

reviews.name: Guy Lodge
reviews.message: “Will-o’-the-Wisp” lives up to the flighty, elusive promise of its title, teasing its viewers in more ways than one...

reviews.name: Ryan Swen
reviews.message: Rodrigues’ concentration of his plot, his ability to elide the parts that would prevent this from taking full flight as a musical fantasy, preserves [Will-o'-the-Wisp's] strange and uncanny spell.

reviews.name: Leslie Felperin
reviews.message: Will light a lot of fires.

reviews.name: Jara Yáñez
reviews.message:
A fun celebration, sophisticated, intelligent, and rich in art… containing a powerful political potency. 
[Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Allan Hunter
reviews.message: Served up with lashings of homoeroticism, Bunuelian satire, a gay love story and an athletic dance number, its uncompromising nature will delight fans of the visionary filmmaker.

reviews.name: Charles Bramesco
reviews.message: A man on his deathbed recounts his youth as a firefighter in João Pedro Rodrigues' queer feature.

title: Close to Vermeer
description: Go behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. Capturing the imagination of the art world -- with glowing reviews, global publicity, and tickets sold out through the entirety of its run -- the Rijksmuseum's Vermeer retrospective is nothing short of an historic event. Suzanne Raes's film follows curators, conservators, collectors, and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master. This fascinating documentary reveals everything from the quiet diplomacy required to get the Vermeers to the Netherlands and the new technical knowledge gained by scanning the paintings layer by layer, to the shocking news that one work may not be by Vermeer after all. In the process, we discover how Vermeer was able to depict reality so differently from his contemporaries. But above all, Close to Vermeer shows the infectious love Vermeer's art inspires. As one curator lovingly puts it: "A good exhibition should change your view of the world. Vermeer can really do that."

characteristics.Producer:: Ilja Roomans

title: White Balls on Walls
description: Amsterdam's Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art wants to become more diverse and inclusive. But how to go about that? An honest look behind the scenes into the sometimes-fraught process taking place in many public institutions.

characteristics.Producer:: Elize Kerseboom, Frank van den Engel

reviews.name: Sarah Gopaul
reviews.message: This is a surprisingly candid portrayal of an organization striving to be better and recognizing that embracing their discomfort is the only way to move forward.

title: MobKing
description: After returning home from a lengthy prison sentence, a loyal crime family confidant quickly realizes that he and his family are the targets of the organization that he remained devoted to all of his life. In order to save his family, he must choose whether to run or fight back.

characteristics.Producer:: Antoni Corone, Jokes Yanes, Cristy Trabadass
characteristics.Writer:: Jokes Yanes, J. Bishop, Cristy Trabadass, Ciro Dapagio
characteristics.Production Co:: Button Man Films, Mainman Productions, Ciro Dapagio Films

title: Godday Godday Chaa
description: During the 1990s, women are not allowed to accompany men to baraats or attend pheras. Rani intends to put an end to this and starts building a team with other women to fight for women's rights.

characteristics.Producer:: Varun Arora

title: Shin Kamen Rider
description: Hongo Takeshi awakens to discover he has been transformed into a grasshopper-hybrid cyborg. Becoming the Masked Rider, he must fight the mysterious evil organization SHOCKER to protect all of mankind. "SHIN KAMEN RIDER" is Anno Hideaki's ode to the legendary Tokusatsu franchise, Japan's biggest hero, and his dearest childhood icon. Go! Go! Let's go!

characteristics.Producer:: Muneyuki Kii

title: Enter the Slipstream
description: With their superstar "Rigo" Uran coming back from a catastrophic injury, the U.S.A.'s oldest professional cycling team aims to win the Tour de France.

characteristics.Producer:: Matthew T. Rogers

title: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
description: Miles Morales returns for the next chapter of the Oscar®-winning Spider-Verse saga, an epic adventure that will transport Brooklyn's full-time, friendly neighborhood Spider-Man across the Multiverse to join forces with Gwen Stacy and a new team of Spider-People to face off with a villain more powerful than anything they have ever encountered.

characteristics.Director:: Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers, Justin K. Thompson
characteristics.Producer:: Chris Miller, Phil Lord, Amy Pascal, Avi Arad, Christina Steinberg
characteristics.Writer:: Phil Lord, Chris Miller, David Callaham
characteristics.Production Co:: Arad Productions, Pascal Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation, Marvel Entertainment, Sony Pictures Entertainment, Lord Miller

title: Simulant
description: Set in the near future, Evan (Robbie Amell), an android simulant, is created for Faye (Jordana Brewster) to replace her dead husband. To fully realize all his human traits, Evan enlists Casey (Simu Liu), a brilliant global hacker whose mission is to remove all restrictions governing simulants' thoughts and capabilities. In doing so, he unleashes an A.I. uprising, triggering a government manhunt led by Agent Kessler (Sam Worthington) who will take extreme measures to eliminate the rise of the android machines.

characteristics.Producer:: Tim Doiron, James van der Woerd
characteristics.Production Co:: Vertical Entertainment, WANGO Films, Three Point Capital, Myriad Pictures

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Gave me the impression this was just hokum.

reviews.name: Katie Hogan
reviews.message: A mixture of a heart-breaking love story, sci-fi action and a ticking clock thriller, Simulant is a worthy addition to the sub-genre.

reviews.name: Sarah Gopaul
reviews.message: [T]he film doesn’t try to simplify the intricacies of the treatment of simulants, leaving it to audiences to decide which side, if either, is more valid.

reviews.name: Chris Knight
reviews.message: It’s an intriguing universe with a lot of potential directions to explore. The trouble is the screenplay wants to explore all of them. With so many threads and only 95 minutes, it’s too much slick surface, not enough philosophical underpinning.

reviews.name: Eric Marchen
reviews.message: Simulant doesn’t stimulate the mind with enough original stirring concepts to standout on its own.

reviews.name: Barry Hertz
reviews.message: A sometimes confused and always lazy pastiche of warmed-over ideas about humanity, technology and What It All Really Means. More artificial, less intelligence.

title: The Boogeyman
description: High school student Sadie Harper and her younger sister Sawyer are reeling from the recent death of their mother and aren't getting much support from their father, Will, a therapist who is dealing with his own pain. When a desperate patient unexpectedly shows up at their home seeking help, he leaves behind a terrifying supernatural entity that preys on families and feeds on the suffering of its victims.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Terror|Teen Drug Use|Some Strong Language|Violent Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Shawn Levy, Dan Levine, Dan Cohen
characteristics.Writer:: Scott Beck, Bryan Woods, Mark Heyman

title: Past Lives
description: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Two decades later, they are reunited in New York for one fateful week as they confront notions of destiny, love, and the choices that make a life, in this heartrending modern romance.

characteristics.Producer:: David Hinojosa, Pamela Koffler, Christine Vachon
characteristics.Production Co:: CJ Entertainment, 2AM, CJ ENM Co., A24, Killer Films

reviews.name: Taylor Baker
reviews.message: the rawness that the lead actors wear in their performances elevate the film and confirm Song as one of the most exciting screenwriting dramatists since Florian Zeller burst on the scene with 2020’s The Father.

reviews.name: Matt Oakes
reviews.message: Song makes it all feel so natural and real, allowing an outsider’s glimpse into this simmering relationship to blossom into something closer to deep knowing and genuine intimacy.

reviews.name: Sean Burns
reviews.message: An achingly lovely debut. Song’s touch is deft, delicate and it sure gets a little dusty in the auditorium at the end.

reviews.name: Amy Taubin
reviews.message: Life experience makes me judge them more harshly than do the film's director...I would have preferred not to have spent two hours with either of them.

reviews.name: Lawrence Garcia
reviews.message: With Past Lives, director Celine Song has a fine story on her hands — and she knows it. Unfortunately, a solid story hook is about all Past Lives amounts to, lacking as it does any robust cinematic interest.

reviews.name: Sarah Manvel
reviews.message: A perfect movie. “Past Lives” is flawless. Do not miss it under any circumstances.

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: Celine Song has the right vibe, sensibility, and rhythm to build what others may consider a rom-com like When Harry Met Sally... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alex Billington
reviews.message: How can anyone put into words all the emotions & feelings that one person has for another? It's impossible. No spoken language on this planet has the right words to describe all those feelings and their nuances. There is, however, the language of cinema.

reviews.name: Shubhra Gupta
reviews.message: If Celine Song’s Past Lives allows men and women to break out of gender expectations, John Trengrove’s Manodrome holds out an olive branch to the kind of alpha men who use the gym as a place of validation.

reviews.name: Zhuo-Ning Su
reviews.message: Captivating and profoundly moving...

reviews.name: Savina Petkova
reviews.message: Past Lives is layered, nuanced, and whole at the same time and in its singularity maybe there is the hope to counter the necessarily fragmented human nature.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Neither melodramatic nor maudlin, Song’s poetic precision conveys experiences we may all be familiar with but are often the most difficult to express so astutely, if only because we are so inarticulate in the communication or processing of such emotions.

reviews.name: James Mottram
reviews.message: Tender and moving, Past Lives will touch the depths of your soul with its honesty and integrity.

reviews.name: Rafaela Sales Ross
reviews.message: Past Lives unravels as a marvel, cemented in a rare balance of wit and grief beautifully embodied by Magaro and Lee.

reviews.name: Tim Grierson
reviews.message: Making an utterly assured feature debut, writer-director Celine Song modulates the delicate tonal balance of this wise, wistful film perfectly.

reviews.name: Pat Brown
reviews.message: Diverging from romances in which lovers are expected to move heaven, earth, and themselves in order to make a moment of love last forever, Past Lives asks us to embrace the changes that come with time.

reviews.name: Murtada Elfadl
reviews.message: Past Lives makes time for the minutiae that define the immigrant experience.

reviews.name: Tomris Laffly
reviews.message: Telling a delicate tale about missed connections, what ifs and the parts of ourselves we keep buried within, Past Lives might just be the most singularly exquisite film of this year’s Sundance.

reviews.name: Ross Bonaime
reviews.message: Song’s work here is incredible, as this story of the past and present, and what it means for the future is a carefully handled story told with love and heart.

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: For what it is, it does tell a bittersweet love story well, but I just found it stressful to watch.

reviews.name: Thomas Stoneham-Judge
reviews.message: As the credits roll, viewers may find themselves with only one word floating through their minds then gently escaping their lips: “woah”.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: It’s a minor film in its scope and structure, and yet it feels so very major.

reviews.name: Wael Khairy
reviews.message: Past Lives perfectly captures the shared feeling of melancholic longing between two souls. It basks us in the yearning for forbidden love better than any film I’ve seen this decade.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: A delicate, touching, stunner of a debut film with astonishingly honest and real writing.

reviews.name: Josie Melendez
reviews.message: Fueled by possibilities, pining, and yearning, Past Lives is one of the best films to come out in recent years.

reviews.name: Aaron White
reviews.message: An achingly emotional Korean relationship drama about fate, pursuing dreams, regrets, and finding happiness where you are.

reviews.name: Nicolas Rapold
reviews.message: It’s a movie that understands how yearning lives in your body even when you think you’ve set it aside.

reviews.name: Sam Adams
reviews.message: January isn’t usually the time to start making Top 10 lists, but I can already confidently put Past Lives on mine.

reviews.name: Ty Burr
reviews.message: “Past Lives” is based on events in the director’s own life, and it has the quiet impact of home truths.

reviews.name: David Rooney
reviews.message: An exquisite original.

reviews.name: Alissa Wilkinson
reviews.message: Past Lives is a miraculous little film from A24, steady and slow and haunted, in the existential sense, by possibilities.

reviews.name: Carlos Aguilar
reviews.message: An exquisitely wistful drama that speaks with an honesty so affectingly crisp it will turn your conceptions of love, identity and fate on their head.

reviews.name: Mae Abdulbaki
reviews.message: The story is simple, but there is beauty in its layers, its performances & the heart-wrenching & deeply moving connection between its characters.

reviews.name: Chris Evangelista
reviews.message: Past Lives is destined to be one of the best movies of 2023.

reviews.name: Jordan Raup
reviews.message: It’s a warm, patient film culminating in a quietly powerful, reflective finale, though its sum is greater than its parts when the first two sections register a touch underdeveloped.

reviews.name: Richard Lawson
reviews.message: It is a very tough thing indeed to make a film that is at once restrained and brimming with feeling, a movie that could be fairly described as both big and small.

reviews.name: Peter Debruge
reviews.message: Few are the films that offer such revelatory conversations between men and women.

reviews.name: David Ehrlich
reviews.message: [A] delicate yet crushingly beautiful film...

reviews.name: Benjamin Lee
reviews.message: It’s a beautiful, transporting film but one made with both feet firmly on the ground.

title: Padre Pio
description: World War I has ended and Italian soldiers, broken but victorious, are returning to an impoverished village ruled by wealthy landowners. As events surrounding the first free election in Italy threaten to tear the village apart, Padre Pio struggles with his own personal demons, ultimately emerging from his spiritual anguish to become one of Catholicism's most venerated figures.

characteristics.Producer:: Philipp Kreuzer, Diana Phillips
characteristics.Production Co:: Carte Blanche Film, Maze Pictures, Interlinea Films

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: A clunky, strange and austere biopic on the Italian priest Padre Pio.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: It overflows with big themes and fascinating people, so the textured, naturalistic performances add weight. But the subdued pace and anecdotal structure are tricky to engage with, and the historical setting is more interesting than the plot.

reviews.name: Fred Barrett
reviews.message: But even with its flaws, Padre Pio can be recognized as an admirable and deeply personal effort — for both its director and its star — that still packs the occasional cinematic punch.

reviews.name: Marshall Shaffer
reviews.message: Ferrara does not hold back in showing the physical and emotional devastation inflicted on the town by the Great War.

reviews.name: Vikram Murthi
reviews.message: A dull journey to a foregone conclusion.

reviews.name: David Katz
reviews.message: In the context of cancel culture, what better rejoinder to the annihilating disappearing act of a “cancellation” than the notion of forgiveness—although we can well be rightly uncomfortable watching LaBeouf here after all he’s been accused of.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Interesting for completists but hardly as interesting as the figure or material it depicts, Padre Pio isn’t so much a biopic but a mutated chimera of jarring cinematic elements.

reviews.name: Robbie Collin
reviews.message: In cinematic confession, no number of Hail Marys could make amends for this.

reviews.name: Jordan Mintzer
reviews.message: It’s been a while that the maker of such ‘90s masterworks as King of New York... and The Addiction hasn’t been fully on top of his game, but Padre Pio, despite molto sincerity and a few flashes of bravado, feels beyond the point of redemption.

reviews.name: Allan Hunter
reviews.message: Abel Ferrara combines spiritual anguish and political turmoil in a film that is for the most part restrained, serious-minded and quietly compelling.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: It is a minor film, but interesting.

title: Lynch/Oz
description: The themes, images, and cultural vernacular of Victor Fleming's The Wizard of Oz continue to haunt David Lynch's art and filmography -- from his very first short, The Alphabet, to his latest series, Twin Peaks: The Return. Arguably, no filmmaker has so consistently drawn inspiration -- consciously or unconsciously -- from a single work. Is David Lynch trapped in the land of Oz? If so, can we derive a new appreciation for Lynch's body of work from taking a closer look at how it intersects and communicates with The Wizard of Oz? In turn, do Mulholland Drive, Lost Highway or The Elephant Man have something to say about the enduring resonance of America's most beloved holiday movie? Through six distinct perspectives, and narrated by some of contemporary cinema's most exciting voices, LYNCH/OZ will take us down the proverbial rabbit hole, help us re-experience and re-interpret The Wizard of Oz by way of David Lynch, to deliver a whole new appreciation for Lynch's symbolism through the lens of his greatest influence.

characteristics.Producer:: Kerry Deignan Roy
characteristics.Writer:: Alexandre O. Philippe, Alexandre O. Philippe

reviews.name: Greg Carlson
reviews.message: Philippe strikes a balance between the mesmerizing, endlessly fascinating constructions of the David Lynch Cinematic Universe and the durability of the powerful spell on moviemaking enjoyed for decades by The Wizard of Oz.

reviews.name: Milana Vujkov
reviews.message: [Director Alexandre O.] Philippe is turning out to be a virtuoso in translating cinematic sorcery into cultural code, firmly positioned on those ever-so-potent crossroads of zeitgeist and cinema.

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: Even though the accumulation of quotes and the waterfall of ideas can overwhelm at times, Lynch/Oz is a fascinating experience: visually hypnotic, challenging, and intellectually admirable. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Lynch/Oz is joyous cinema nerdiness, making the audience feel part of an unfocused but enthusiastic cinematic discussion.

reviews.name: Carmen Paddock
reviews.message: The result is a full-scale celebration of beautifully rendered images that invites further independent exploration.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Cleverly weaving in hundreds of clips, filmmaker Alexandre O Philippe finds fascinating parallels everywhere, and especially in the films of David Lynch. Set out in idiosyncratic chapters, it's essential viewing for movie fans.

reviews.name: Linda Marric
reviews.message: An absolute must

reviews.name: Alistair Harkness
reviews.message: Philippe attempts to use The Wizard of Oz’s status as the foundational fairytale of American pop culture to decode this most playfully cryptic of filmmakers.

reviews.name: Danny Leigh
reviews.message: ... Anyone who calls themselves a film lover should have a working knowledge of perhaps the last true artist in American movies. And from his niche, Philippe has universal lessons about the nature of influence.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: At the heart of Lynch/Oz is a deep love of the auteur’s work from Philippe and his contributors. This genuine fascination is what makes Lynch/Oz exciting and so compelling.

reviews.name: Marina Ashioti
reviews.message: Varied, compelling and evocative explorations of Lynch’s craft and thought processes.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: At all events, it’s a very enjoyable creative speculation.

reviews.name: Michael Talbot-Haynes
reviews.message: There is more grasping of straws here than when they were trying to put the scarecrow back together.

reviews.name: Drew Tinnin
reviews.message: The documentary Lynch/Oz is a hypnotic deep dive into David Lynch’s fascination (or obsession) with The Wizard of Oz. Looking at all of his films through the lens of the 1939 classic provides tremendous insight into Lynch’s oeuvre.

reviews.name: Jason Gorber
reviews.message: This is a documentary that beautifully fosters critical discourse while also, with every shot, reminding about what a magical experience truly loving a cinematic work can be.

reviews.name: Martyn Conterio
reviews.message: What Philippe does yet again, as with his his previous documentaries, is a bang-up job of examining what makes great films great, and here it is twofold.

reviews.name: Andrew Murray
reviews.message: Lynch/Oz is...a grand love letter to cinema as much as it is to Lynch.

reviews.name: Richard Whittaker
reviews.message: Even its flaws and occasional moments of repetition between authors cannot detract from this fascinating collection about one of the great filmmakers of our era.

reviews.name: Caitlyn Downs
reviews.message: Alexandre O. Philippe continues to deliver absorbing studies of his subjects, accompanied by a host of creatives.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: Few of us would guess that the nightmarish realities constructed by the auteur David Lynch could relate to The Wizard of Oz. When dissected by many of the most brilliant minds of the film industry, the parallels and ideals reverberate throughout each.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: A documentary born from the social media generation, this analysis of director David Lynch’s obsession with “The Wizard of Oz” feels more like a YouTube video made by a rabid fan for a film class project than an insightful feature length film.

reviews.name: Will DiGravio
reviews.message: The film successfully avoids the pitfalls of its deceptively basic premise and instead becomes about so much more.

reviews.name: Rob Aldam
reviews.message: The biggest takeaway from Alexandre O. Philippe’s documentary is, perhaps, the desire to revisit his work and appraise it in a new light.

reviews.name: Chris Evangelista
reviews.message: There's no place like home.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: A unique film for the cerebral crowd.

reviews.name: Owen Gleiberman
reviews.message: If “The Wizard of Oz” is one of your favorite movies, and if Lynch is one of your favorite filmmakers, then watching “Lynch/Oz” is like seeing two old cinematic friends sitting around talking to each other.

reviews.name: Michael Frank
reviews.message: For a Lynch diehard, Lynch/Oz will be catnip. For any average moviegoer, it digs into the well of American cinema history with enough fascination that it’s worth a watch.

reviews.name: Peter Sobczynski
reviews.message: While it may not ultimately be anything more than an extended bit of screen minutiae—the kind of thing that a film major might point out late at night after a toke or 12 stretched out to nearly two hours—it is still kind of fun on some basic level.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: An often compelling, always engrossing recap of the auteur’s penchant for exploring the inherent nightmares lurking somewhere over the rainbow.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: The film stretches in some parts and gets away from its premise in others. But it’s so hugely entertaining — especially if you know The Wizard of Oz and Lynch’s canon equally well — that I’m inclined to let it slide.

reviews.name: David Gonzalez
reviews.message: Never entering the world of being overly preachy, Philippe's Lynch/Oz carefully examines Lynch but never constructs one conclusion, leaving it to the viewer to decide, and David Lynch wouldn't have it any other way.

reviews.name: Simon Abrams
reviews.message: Offers movie-lovers a variety of thoughtful and dynamic new ways of seeing Lynch’s work.

reviews.name: Charles Bramesco
reviews.message: A mite repetitive at nearly two hours, it’s still an edifying intermediate-level study compressing academic insight into personal reflection and vice versa.

reviews.name: Jason Adams
reviews.message: You’ll want to wander the path from Tin Man to Log Lady yourselves, even if it raises more questions than answers

reviews.name: Christopher Bourne
reviews.message: While much of this material is often quite compelling ... this documentary suffers from a lack of focus and palpable overreach.

reviews.name: David Ehrlich
reviews.message: If Lynch/Oz wisely shies away from any sort of unifying theory about what it all means, it sure has a lot of fun assembling the evidence.

reviews.name: Tara Judah
reviews.message: With its impressive array of hundreds of film clips, frenetic editing and whip-smart narrators, Lynch/Oz offers an exciting prism through which to view Lynch’s oeuvre.

reviews.name: John DeFore
reviews.message: An enjoyable, if not entirely satisfying, look at a strange cinematic affinity.

title: Follow Her
description: Jess (Dani Barker) has finally found her hook: secretly filming creepy interactions she encounters via online job listings, and using the kinks of others to fuel her streaming success. For her next episode, she's been hired by Tom (Luke Cook) to write the ending of a screenplay in a remote, lavish cabin. Once there, the alluring self-proclaimed screenwriter hands her a script in which the two of them are the main characters. This client isn't what he seems, and even though the money's great... the real payment here could cost her life. Follow Her is a psycho-sexual thriller which questions the ethical boundaries of social media.

characteristics.Producer:: Dani Barker, Sylvia Caminer, Michael Indjeian
characteristics.Production Co:: Max Freedman Media, Dolger Films, MFM Productions, Classified Films

reviews.name: Eric Langberg
reviews.message: Follow Her stands head and shoulders above most of its "social media horror" peers because it doesn’t forget to have fun.

reviews.name: Sharai Bohannon
reviews.message: It’s muddled and messy in places, but there’s a lot of fun here.

reviews.name: Alejandra Martinez
reviews.message: Follow Her should be a breath of fresh air, and a return to a genre that gets little screentime in our current film landscape. Unfortunately, what unfolds instead is a clumsy, incoherent, and heavy-handed attempt to comment on a mountain of issues

reviews.name: Nadine Whitney
reviews.message: Follow Her isn’t a traditional horror film but it plays cannily with the genre to deliver a dark comedy that is also a pointed rebuke at people who spend their lives curating a personality for consumption.

reviews.name: Michelle Swope
reviews.message: The fact that Follow Her succeeds at being fun, meta, and thought-provoking, while also being a low budget, female-led project, makes this an exceptional movie.

reviews.name: Steve Erickson
reviews.message: Follow Her can’t decide whether it’s a throwback erotic thriller, a #MeToo-inspired tale of misogyny in the film industry or a dark, twisty vision of influencers’ manipulations being cast back at them.

reviews.name: Emily Wheeler
reviews.message: Its playful tossing of expectations is a wild ride to go on.

reviews.name: Fred Topel
reviews.message: Follow Her has an insightful perspective on influencer culture and what that has done to storytelling. It also asks questions about victim-blaming, of which Jess is potentially guilty as well as those who'd suggest she put herself in this situation.

reviews.name: Rebecca Murray
reviews.message: Sylvia Caminer’s feature narrative directorial debut Follow Me is a twisted cautionary tale and a clever skewering of internet celebrity.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: Follow Her taunts mind, body, and spirit to achieve its true impact.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Cook and Barker have a playful, sexy dynamic, which carries the film in-between all the narrative twists. Follow Her is one of the better social media horrors we’ve recently had and one that’ll surely stir up conversation.

reviews.name: Keri O'Shea
reviews.message: The rise and rise of social media has definitively blurred the line between consent and content [...] This brings us to Follow Her (2022), a brutal, succinct and fast-paced story about some very modern anxieties.

reviews.name: Kat Hughes
reviews.message: A bold and ambitious film, Follow Her constantly subverts expectations and gives the viewer plenty of food for thought. Seductively engrossing and enticingly dark, Follow Her is a thriller made for women by women.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Sylvia Caminer’s sophisticated feature debut is a two-handed, double-edged erotic thriller exposing the moral pitfalls of online celebrity

reviews.name: Allison Rose
reviews.message: FOLLOW HER is a slow burn, a psychological exploration of the dangers of the internet.

title: Unidentified Objects
description: Peter is a misanthropic dwarf hiding from the world in his shabby New York City apartment. But an unexpected visit from his upbeat--and possibly unhinged--neighbor Winona forces him out of his shell and onto an impromptu road trip. Their destination? What she believes to be the site of an upcoming alien visitation in the wilderness of rural Canada. On their increasingly-surreal odyssey, Peter and Winona will encounter bickering lesbian cosplayers, shroom-addled survivalists, and even extraterrestrial highway cops. But the further they go and the more their trauma comes to light, it becomes clear that the only thing more nerve-wracking than being abducted is being alone in the universe.

characteristics.Producer:: Leland Frankel, Juan Sebastian Jaimes, Matthew Jeffers, Masha Leonov, Ramfis Myrthil, Adam Piotrowicz
characteristics.Production Co:: VSNY Films, Blue Rabbit Films, First Threshold, Hamilton Moving Pictures, Riceball Films , Eidetic Pictures

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: The performances are great, but the genuine take may turn some off. This is not a story concerned with tying a pretty bow around everything. Those who are willing to go on a wild adventure that is incredibly human should enjoy Unidentified Objects.

reviews.name: Jennie Kermode
reviews.message: A quirky yet moving character piece full of absurdist comedy, with an optimistic streak which is rare in cinema today.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: The writing, direction and acting have a lot to say about overcoming fear. It's also a hugely engaging journey that's packed with wonderfully surreal touches and moments that are both hilarious and moving.

reviews.name: Jason Flatt
reviews.message: [Unidentified Objects is] a fantastic deconstruction of aggrievement and self-aggrandizement, and where we might find a balancing point between them to find fulfillment.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: A genre-bending platonic love story that blends science fiction, surrealism, and fantasy into a tale of two eccentric loners searching for their place in the universe.

reviews.name: Mae Abdulbaki
reviews.message: Anchored by lovely performances by Matthew Jeffers and Sarah Hay, the film, with its misleading title, is one that is well worth the watch.

reviews.name: Rob Aldam
reviews.message: While the objective of their expedition might be unusual, it’s what they both learn along the way which is important

reviews.name: DarkSkyLady
reviews.message: Unidentified Objects captures feeling like an alien, an outsider in this world that judges based on appearance, its toll, and the beauty of self-acceptance.

reviews.name: Mike McGranaghan
reviews.message: A quirky road trip movie notable for excellent performances from the two leads.

reviews.name: Leo Brady
reviews.message: It’s that serious approach to the two characters internal struggles that helps push the narrative along, while asking us to walk in these characters shoes, and maybe believe them for what may seem like grand illusions.

reviews.name: David Lynch
reviews.message: This cinematic trip embraces its intimacy the further it ventures into colorfully surreal territory.

title: Rise
description: Élise thought she had the perfect life: an ideal boyfriend and a promising career as a ballet dancer. It all falls apart the day she catches him cheating on her with her stage backup; and after she suffers an injury on stage, it seems like she might not be able to dance ever again. The path to physical and emotional recovery will lead her away from Paris to a picturesque location in Brittany -- where her friends, a new love and the freedom of contemporary dance will help her reconnect with her father and most importantly, herself. A heartwarming and inspiring story that tells us how sometimes, the worst thing that could happen may turn out to be the best.

characteristics.Producer:: Bruno Levy

reviews.name: Pablo Vázquez
reviews.message: A comforting movie, magnificently orchestrated, also mischievous and placid in its indefiniteness, beautiful and playful...

reviews.name: Toni Vall
reviews.message: A fabulous protagonist and some fantastic dance sequences.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Latoya Austin
reviews.message: An antithesis to Black Swan ... Klapisch’s expert direction intimately examines these angst-ridden moments of a ballerina’s mental and physical wellbeing ... a mesmerising and graceful film

reviews.name: Antonio G. Spíndola
reviews.message: Works like a charming feel-good movie with irresistible dance sequences. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: An optimistic yet unromantic view of the life of an injured dancer. [Full review in Spanish]

title: Concerned Citizen
description: A dark comedy about gentrification in which a socially progressive man's attempt to improve his Tel Aviv neighborhood goes unexpectedly awry. A satirical parable about the insidious ways in which privilege can unleash prejudice within.

characteristics.Producer:: Idan Haguel, Gil Sima, Binyamin Gurevich, Itay Akirav
characteristics.Production Co:: Rabinovich Foundation for the Arts, M-Appeal, Israel Film Council

reviews.name: Carlos Bonfil
reviews.message: ... Provocative and incisive. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Even as the film grapples with big themes, writer-director Idan Haguel refreshingly avoids melodrama, keeping the characters and situations solidly grounded.

reviews.name: Ben Turner
reviews.message: A film that drives hard to attain middle-class authenticity, this is a social commentary that’s positioned on the wrong-side of a virtue-signalling mirror.

reviews.name: Ayelet Dekel
reviews.message: a well-crafted dark comedy, a film on a modest scale that touches on wider issues of privilege, urban renewal, xenophobia, and liberal guilt, from an intimate perspective.

reviews.name: Hannah Brown
reviews.message: Concerned Citizen is a carefully told, well-acted slice of life, but it could have been much more than that.

reviews.name: Vassilis Kroustallis
reviews.message: 'Concerned Citizen' is a fine reminder of the need to constantly readdress rights and privileges, but it uses a very heads-on approach to address issues that are not eradicated by a simple act of redemption

title: Jawan
description: An emotional journey of a man who is set to rectify the wrongs in the society, in an attempt to get even with his past, driven by a personal vendetta while keeping up to a promise made years ago. A high-octane action thriller where he is up against a dreadful monstrous outlaw who knows no fear and has caused extreme suffering to many. In the journey he will cross paths with a high-minded seasoned lady officer whose emotions might get the better of her as she gets involved in this battle. As his past catches up with him, to overcome the challenges and restore the harmony in their world, he will need all the firepower and intelligence to do so.

characteristics.Producer:: Gauri Khan

title: Montréal Girls
description: A Middle-Eastern medical school student, new to Montreal, puts his relationship with his father at risk when he forfeits his education after being forever changed by two young women who shatter his limited beliefs in himself and his destiny.

characteristics.Producer:: Samuel Gagnon, Patricia Chica, Bahija Essoussi-Gagnon

reviews.name: Emilie Black
reviews.message: Montréal Girls captures the vibes and feel of a city and group of its population just right.

reviews.name: Bradley Gibson
reviews.message: Montreal Girls is as much a visual and sonic poem as it is narrative storytelling.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: It's truly a joy to watch Montreal Girls.
